article.headline: American 65, Army 48
article.story: UPPER MARLBORO, Md. (AP)-- Andres Rodriguez scored 16 points as American extended its longest winning streak in 12 years with a 65-48 win over Army on Saturday in the Patriot League quarterfinals. The Eagles (17-12) have won five straight for the first time since 1991-92 season when they were in the Colonial Athletic Association. American, which has played in the last two Patriot League finals, will face the winner of Saturday's final game between Lafayette and Colgate in Sunday's second semifinal. Rodriguez hit a 3-pointer to cap a 22-3 run that opened the game, a lead American would push as high as 24 in the first half. Josh Wilson scored 16 points to lead Army, which lost its fifth straight. After falling behind early, Army resorted to a 3-point exclusive attack in the second half. The Black Knights hit just one two-point field goal after halftime, compared to eight 3-pointers on 16 attempts. Andre Ingram and Jason Thomas each scored 13 for American, hit seven of its first 10 shots on its way to a 39-21 halftime lead.
